block.p: Sandra Joyce Sullivan, the daughter of Mr. and Mrs. William E. Sullivan of Ho-Ho-Kus, N.J., was married yesterday to John Norris Barnes, the son of Mr. and Mrs. J. Norris Barnes III of Winston-Salem, N.C. The Rev. Lidabell Lunt Pollard, a Congregational minister, performed the ceremony at the chapel on Chocorua Island in Squam Lake in Holderness, N.H.

Mrs. Barnes, 31, owns and operates the Barn, a child development center in Bozeman, Mont. She graduated from Bucknell University and received a master's degree in social work from Boston University. Her father retired as a senior vice president and the director for individual financial services at Merrill Lynch & Company in New York. Her father and her mother, Joyce P. Sullivan, also own the Lazy River Ranch, a cattle and hay ranch in Boulder, Wyo.

Sandra Joyce Sullivan, the daughter of Mr. and Mrs. William E. Sullivan of Ho-Ho-Kus, N.J., was married yesterday to John Norris Barnes, the son of Mr. and Mrs. J. Norris Barnes III of Winston-Salem, N.C. The Rev. Lidabell Lunt Pollard, a Congregational minister, performed the ceremony at the chapel on Chocorua Island in Squam Lake in Holderness, N.H.

Mrs. Barnes, 31, owns and operates the Barn, a child development center in Bozeman, Mont. She graduated from Bucknell University and received a master's degree in social work from Boston University. Her father retired as a senior vice president and the director for individual financial services at Merrill Lynch & Company in New York. Her father and her mother, Joyce P. Sullivan, also own the Lazy River Ranch, a cattle and hay ranch in Boulder, Wyo.

Mr. Barnes, 30, is a fly-fishing guide in Bozeman. He graduated from the University of North Carolina at Wilmington. His mother, Anne E. Barnes, is a saleswoman at the Gazebo, a clothing store, and his father is a senior consultant with the Sabre Group, airline technology consultants, both in Winston-Salem.
